review: The fire TV stick has far exceeded my expectations. I was hoping that I could find an inexpensive Apple TV replacement and I think I did.  The remote works great. The pictures is crisp and everything about the set-up as intuitive and quick.  I like the quick and easy connectivity to both Netflix and amazon prime movies.  My biggest issues with Apple TV is that it is such a pain to switch content providers.  The fire Stick's methods are vastly superior.  I am curious as to how the whole fire TV would perform and if there are noticeable differences.  I just can't think of any useful features that are not included in the stick.  Love it.
author: M. Hertz from Manassas

review: "Fire TV Stick also supports standards like DIAL so you can also fling services like YouTube, Spotify, and coming soon, Netflix, from your Android phone or iPhone." This made it seem that it would work just like the Chromecast does but i hav not found any way to do that. I gave the stick one extra star because i do like the interface i just wish i had the added functionality that the Chromecast offers.

review: PROs: Fluid interface, low profile.CONs: Limited access to content apps (Crunchyroll for example).Overall: I'm giving it to my parents for Christmas. I loved the updated hardware and interface compared to my Roku 3 but I use Crunchyroll a fair amount and wish it had access to a wider band of content apps. I'm not sure who the blame falls on there (Amazon, Android, Crunchyroll, etc) but it would be nice.
